result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Shane C Reeves in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF86, 14CF91, 14CF102, 14CM56.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court insructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  

14CF86-DRI

14CF91-Ct 1 and Ct 3-DRI  DE will enter a plea of NC to Ct 2, Withhold sentence 1 yr probation, CC, no expunction, write letter of apology, DNA sample, cost waived

14CF101-Amend Ct 1, NC, Withhold sentence 3 yrs probation, CC,  expunction, apology letter, restitution of $1000.00 J/S with 14CF104 Cassandra Tomaszewski, DNA sample, cost waived.
 Ct 2-NC, Withhold sentence 1 yrs probation, CC, NO expunction 

14CF102-Ct 1-DRI, Ct 2-NC-Withhold sentence 3 yrs probation, CC,  eligible for expunction, apology letter, restitution of $6106.00 J/S with 14CF103 Cassandra Tomaszewski, DNA sample, cost waived.

14CM56-DRI, but will pay restitution of $845.39

DE will waive PSI preparation.  State addresses the court.  Victims would like to address the courts.  Restitution requested in the amount of $7951.39, $7106.00 Joint/several with the co-defendant, will pay CC, has credit for 69 days.   Will order restitution repaid thru term of  probation.  Bond will apply to rest.  waive surcharge, but provide sample,

Defendant Shane C Reeves in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Andrea Amidon Nodolf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF91.    Waive formal reading of Criminal Complaints.  Atty asks for a sign bond, with no contacts.
